title: Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City
Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-34-generic, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: I downloaded Xliveless and installed it into the game directory. Added tv.rockstargames.com to the file /etc/hosts. Minor graphical glitches in the sky and occasional flickering shadows. If framerates are low, lower visibility range. 1440p works fine for me, but some may have to go with 1080p for a smoother experience. Nvidia users may have to do some extra steps: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/350. Have Esync disabled always, since GTA V needed it, so that may be worth a try.
title: Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City

notes:
Used xliveless. Did those two things: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/350#issuecomment-419514874
and
https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/350#issuecomment-418909900
The paths for nvapi may differ for you, for me they did at least.
Draw distance kills the performance. On high settings (with draw distance and details set to the lowest) I'm getting 25-50fps depending on the area. There are some graphical glitches. I suggest turning off in-game V-Sync. I could play like this. But more testing is needed
title: Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City

notes: Need xliveless and a line in the /etc/hosts. (127.0.0.1 tv.rockstargames.com). It has poor perfomrance.
title: Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City
